name: Outrageous NFL Games Quiz / Test | American Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Chicago Bears had a mediocre 8-3 season in 1940.  They would go to the NFL Championship game and win with an embarrassing 73-0 blowout.  Which team was on the losing end of this?
questions.explanation:
Washington Redskins.

	None of the other teams were in the NFL in 1940.  The Bears scored seven touchdowns from the ground, one from the air, and two via interceptions.  It was 28-0 by halftime, and 54-0 at the end of the third quarter.

questions.text: In January 2000, the Miami Dolphins were ransacked 62-7 .  They were at the mercy of quarterbacks Jay Fielder and Mark Brunell, and running back Fred Taylor.  Which team was the victor in this embarrassment?
questions.explanation:
Jacksonville Jaguars.

	Taylor rushed for 135 yards, including a 90-yard first quarter touchdown.  He also caught a 35-yard touchdown in the second quarter.  A Dan Marino touchdown pass in the second quarter would be Miami's only score, in the 2nd week of the play-offs.  Fielder and Brunell threw for two touchdowns each for the Jaguars.  The Jaguars went on to lose the AFC Championship Game 4-33 to the Titans.

questions.text: In December 1970, this Super Bowl bound team would walk away from the Cotton Bowl with a 5-0 win over the Detroit Lions.  The only score needed was a 26-yard field goal by Mike Clark, then a fourth quarter safety was given away by the Lions.  Which team won this real snoozer of a game?
questions.explanation:
Dallas Cowboys.

	The 10-4 NFC Champion Cowboys met the 11-2-1 AFC Champion Colts in Super Bowl V.  The Colts walked away from this one with a 16-13 win.

questions.text: In November 2004, the Cleveland Browns scored a big 48 points in a game.  The unfortunate problem is that they lost the game by 10 points.  This was mainly caused by quarterback Carson Palmer's four touchdown passes and T.J. Houshmandzadeh who caught two of them.  Who was the victorious team in this 58-48 game?
questions.explanation:
Cincinnati Bengals.

	The Browns suffered a real mess in this game.  Their quarterback, Kelly Holcomb, threw five touchdown passes and Steve Heiden rushed for three touchdowns.  It was all for not.  The Bengals finished the season at 8-8, and the Browns at 4-12 in the AFC North.

questions.text: This October 2009 game saw one team shine while the other slept.  It was 59-0 at the end of the third quarter.  Three touchdowns were caught by Randy Moss, and another two by Wes Welker.  Who was this victorious team?
questions.explanation:
New England Patriots.

	Patriot quarterback Tom Brady threw six touchdown passes in this game against the Tennessee Titans.  The Patriots would finish 10-6 to win the AFC East, but would lose in the wildcard game to the Ravens.  The Titans finished the season at 8-8.

questions.text: In December 1970, the Dallas Cowboys won a game by the score of 6-2.  Their opponent's quarterback, Bill Nelsen, threw for 239 yards compared to Dallas' 72.  Which team was the loser of this game?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland Browns.

	Dallas won with two Mike Clark fields goals and a safety.  This was the first of two strange games for the Cowboys in December 1970.  Two weeks later, they defeated the Lions 5-0.  The Cowboys went on to the Super Bowl, but lost to the Colts.

questions.text: This 1961 game was a 53-0 blowout against the Washington Redskins.  The winners were led by the arm of Y.A. Tittle and the legs of Del Shofner and Bob Gaiters.  Jimmy Patton also returned a 51-yard interception for a touchdown, and Pat Summerall added another extra-point.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
New York Giants.

	Tittle and Lee Grosscup of the Giants threw four interceptions in the game, and the Redskins couldn't capitalize on anything.  The Redskins also rushed for only 31 yards.  The 32-0 end of third quarter score wasn't enough for the Giants, so they scored 21 more in the fourth.

questions.text: This 1954 game saw the Redskins lose big by a score on 62-3.  The Redskins watched their opponents score at will.  This included Otto Graham's rushing and throwing touchdowns, George Ratterman's touchdown passes, and a kick by Lou Groza here and there.  Who was this victorious team?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland Browns.

	The score was 49-3 at the end of the third quarter.  Washington's only score in the game was a second quarter Vic Janowicz 37-yard field goal.  The Browns went on to win the NFL Championship that season.

questions.text: In Super Bowl XXIV, the two best teams were supposed to go head-to-head, but one team didn't show up.  Who won this 55-10 blowout against the Broncos, with Joe Montana taking the snaps for the winner?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco 49ers.

	The Broncos defense was dismal in this January 1990 big game.  The 49ers' Jerry Rice caught three touchdown passes, but it didn't stop there.  Montana shared his touchdown passes with receiver John Taylor and running back Brent Jones.  Tom Rathman abd Roger Craig had a rushing TD each.  Denver's only touchdown came on a three-yard run from quarterback John Elway in the third quarter.

questions.text: This October 1964 game was hard fought, and at the end, both teams walked away with a 43-43 tie.  The Raiders scored their final nine points in the fourth quarter, while their opponent's quarterback Babe Parilli threw two touchdowns, and Larry Garron ran for another.  Which team was this that tied the Raiders after scoring 22 points in the fourth quarter?
questions.explanation:
Boston Patriots.

	What a passing game with Oakland's Cotton Davidson throwing for 337 yards, and Boston's Babe Parilli throwing for 422 yards.  Parilli also threw four interceptions.  Neither team made the playoffs with the Patriots finishing the season at 5-9, and the Raiders at 6-8.
